input.name: __VIEWSTATE

div.span: April 16, 2020 Update - Board Meeting, Meal Pick Up, Open Enrollment, School Fees

strong.span: *** Click Here for Online Resources for Parents ***

span.strong: We will continue meal pick-ups next Monday, April 20th from 10:30-12:30 at Margaretta Elementary at the parent pick-up loop off of Maple Ave. We will once again provide 5 days worth of meals.
If you have any questions, please call (419) 504-1606 and leave a message.

The Margaretta Board of Education meeting scheduled for Monday, April 20, 2020 at 6:30 p.m. will be conducted ONLINE. Board members will attend the meeting online via Zoom, and the Zoom meeting will be streamed live to the Margaretta Schools Facebook page.
Relevant comments/questions will be monitored on the live stream and forwarded to the board members.

Open Enrolllment Applications can be picked up or dropped off at the Board Office. Applications must be in by April 30, 2020. School fees can be paid at or mailed to the Board Office. This is especially important for seniors.

a.strong: April 2, 2020 Update - Additional Assignment Delivery Information
March 23 - Meal Update - Single Pick-up Site

span.div: Click the title for more IMPORTANT details.

The final payment for the Washington D.C. trip has been postponed until further notice. Discussion of our options are ongoing with Martin Travel. When a decision is made and restrictions are lifted we will have a parent meeting. Disregard any pre-recorded messages from Martin Travel regarding payment, and DO NOT make your final payment until instructed to do so by Margaretta.
Please monitor this website for more information.
Any questions- email me at kmiller@margarettaschooldistrict.com

img.title: iready
img.alt: MES Parents - Using iReady At Home

div.span: MES Parents - Using iReady At Home

span.div: Please click here for instructions and assistance for using iReady at home.
Don't forget to order your High School and Middle School yearbooks. Both can be ordered online at jostenyearbook.com, search for Margaretta. High School yearbooks are $50, and Middle School are $20.
Each student has one number automatically added into our One Call Now system. The number we use is the "Primary" number listed on your child's Emergency Medical Form.
If you wish to ADD phone numbers for One Call notifications, you can add numbers to the "Family Profile Link" on our One Call webpage: One Call Now (click title for more information)

img.title: polarpress

div.span: New Edition of Margaretta Polar Press School Newspaper
For the February 28, 2020 and previous editions of the Polar Press click here.

span.div: Regular meetings of the Margaretta Board of Education are held on the third Monday of the month at 6:30 p.m., unless otherwise noted. The 2020 regular meeting schedule is set as follows: (click title for more)

div.div:
Monday, January 20, 2020
Monday, February 17, 2020
Monday, March 16, 2020

span.p:
HIGH SCHOOL:
High School Cheerleading tryout packets are now available. Any student in grades 8-11 interested in trying out for cheerleading for the 2020-2021 school year please pick up a packet in Mrs. Drossman's room 123. There will be a mandatory informational meeting Tuesday, March 17 at 6 p.m. in the cafeteria.
This year’s dodgeball tournament has been cancelled due to the most recent district precautions.
span.div: The Winter Sports Banquet has been cancelled due to the most recent district precautions.

div.a: Zoom and Facebook live Board of Education (BOE) Regular Meeting

br.span: BOE Office, 305 S. Washington St., Castalia

div.span: The Margaretta Local School District will deliver an education that supports academic achievement in a safe environment that provides the knowledge and skills needed to be college and career ready.
